item.title: Llama 2
item.description: - Llama 2 is the next generation of an open-source large language model that is available for free for research and commercial use.

item.title: Firefox has surpassed Chrome on Speedometer
item.description: - Firefox has recently overtaken Chrome in terms of speed on a benchmark called Speedometer.

item.title: Refusing to teach kids math will not improve equity
item.description: - "Progressive" approaches to math education, such as delaying the teaching of subjects like algebra, are being implemented in some places like California and Cambridge, Massachusetts.

item.title: Stable Diffusion WebGPU demo
item.description: - The "Stable Diffusion WebGPU demo" requires the latest version of Chrome with specific flags enabled.

item.title: Sweden Sans
item.description: - The primary typeface used in Sweden's brand communications is Sweden Sans, which was inspired by old signages system in Sweden and designed for accessibility, simplicity, and consistency.

item.title: A Grub theme in the style of Minecraft
item.description: - This post introduces Minegrub, a Grub theme inspired by Minecraft.

item.title: A few things to know before stealing my 914 (2022)
item.description: - The author of the post shares humorous advice to someone attempting to steal a Porsche 914, highlighting the various challenges and quirks of the car.

item.title: Val, a high-level systems programming language
item.description: - Val is a high-level systems programming language that aims to be fast, safe, and simple.

item.title: Lazydocker: a lazier way to manage everything Docker
item.description: - Lazydocker is a terminal UI tool that helps manage Docker and Docker-compose in a simpler and more efficient way.

item.title: Medicine is plagued by untrustworthy clinical trials
item.description: - A significant number of clinical trials in the field of medicine may be faked or flawed, according to investigations.
